message.entry: Input must be a string or a cell of strings.
When the output format is set to {0}, the polynomial coefficients must equal either 0 or 1.
The polynomial must use a single variable. Variable name {0} found in term {1} does not match variable name {2} found in a prior term of polynomial {3}.
Invalid polynomial power term {0} in polynomial {1}.
All polynomial powers should be integer. Power {0} in {1} is not integer.
A close brace is missing in term {0} in polynomial {1}.
Polynomial power {0} specified more than once in polynomial {1}.
Term {0} specifies the constant term multiple times in polynomial {1}.
Failed to parse constant term {0} of polynomial {1}.
Variable coefficients must either be numeric scalars or powers of the primitive elememt alpha. Failed to parse coefficient/power {0} of polynomial {1}.
Powers of the primitive elements alpha must be numeric. Failed to parse coefficient {0} of polynomial {1}.
The primitive polynomial input argument (#3) must be either a decimal scalar or a binary vector or a polynomial string.
All polynomial powers need to have the same sign. Power {0} has a different sign than previous terms in polynomial {1}.
Coefficient {0} contains a character that is interpreted as a primitive element, while the PARSEALPHA input of commstr2poly has not been set to true.
